meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel sad or disappointed.
meanings.sent1: Seeing his team lose the game really bringdown him.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather can sometimes bringdown people's moods.
meanings.sent3: The sad movie was a real bringdown, but it had a happy ending.
meanings.sent4: The news of the job cuts really bringdown the employees.
meanings.sent5: The loss of her favorite toy bringdown the little girl to tears.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that depresses or discourages others.
meanings.sent1: She always seemed to be a bringdown with her negative attitude.
meanings.sent2: The constant complainer in the group was considered a bringdown.
meanings.sent3: The rainy day was a bringdown, but they made the best of it.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were a bringdown on the picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The pessimistic friend was a constant bringdown to their spirits.
